The sky appears blue because of a phenomenon called Rayleigh scattering. It's named after the scientist who first explained it, Lord Rayleigh. ðŸ¤“ Essentially, when sunlight enters Earth's atmosphere, it encounters tiny molecules of gases like nitrogen and oxygen.
